meanings: (시위·폭동 등을) repress, suppression, repression, subjugation, suppress, subdue, subjugate, (formal) quell, put down
put down a riot by force

vlive.korean: [진압 실패] 일단 이거 고기 못 먹어! 다 탔어. [Failed] We can't eat this. It's all burnt. 듣기 View video MONSTA X : [MONSTA X] 몬스타엑스 - 출.없.방 #02
vlive.english: [Failed] We can't eat this. It's all burnt.

examples.korean: The army was sent in to crush the rebellion. 발음듣기 반란을 진압하기 위해 군대가 투입되었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The army was sent in to crush the rebellion. 발음

examples.korean: Troops were called in to subdue the rebels. 발음듣기 반란자들을 진압하기 위해 군대가 투입되었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Troops were called in to subdue the rebels. 발음

examples.korean: Government forces have failed to contain the rebellion. 발음듣기 정부군이 반란을 진압하지 못했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Government forces have failed to contain the rebellion. 발음

examples.korean: the ricochet of bricks and bottles off police riot shields 발음듣기 경찰의 진압 방패에 맞아 튀어 나오는 벽돌과 병들 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: the ricochet of bricks and bottles off police riot shields 발음

examples.korean: Extra police were called in to quell the disturbances. 발음듣기 그 소요를 진압하기 위해 경찰이 추가로 투입되었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Extra police were called in to quell the disturbances. 발음
